content.question: The position of a particle moving to the right on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is given by <math alttext="x of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="x of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is measured in centimeters and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in seconds for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="y equals, x of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a linear function, which of the following would most likely give the best estimate of the speed of the particle, in centimeters per second, at time <math alttext="t equals 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator x of 10, and denominator 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x of 11, minus, x of 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>11</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
The slope of the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

content.answer: The slope of the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

topic.text: 1.1: Introducing Calculus - Can Change Occur at an Instant?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
